Question: Though the resolutions followed the "interposition" approach of Madison, this person advocated nullification.
Hints: The historian Gordon S Wood argues that this person's political philosophy was a product of his time and his scientific interests.
By May 1826 this person's health was so frail that he was virtually a shut-in and by June he was confined to bed.
This person believed assimilation was best for Native Americans; second best was removal to the west.
